Subjective: Spot on neck for 2 weeks. Started as small wound after shaving. Thought it was a wart, but not anymore. Insect bite in the same spot, causing swelling and redness. Itches, no pain. No similar spots before. No skin malignancies in the family. Request: Wants spot removed, prefers freezing method.
Objective: Half cm raised pinkish-red spot on neck with slightly redder center. No scab or flaking. No similar spots elsewhere. No swollen lymph nodes in the neck. Freckles present, but not similar to the spot.
Assessment: Unclear diagnosis. Possibilities: Pyogenic granuloma or atypical mole. Ruled out: Wart, freckle.
Plan: 1. Send a picture of the spot to a dermatologist for e-consultation.
2. Patient will call GP on Friday (before 10 am or after 3 pm) for dermatologist's advice.
3. Discuss removal methods: Freezing, excision, or scraping with tissue analysis.
4. Make a separate appointment to evaluate knee pain that lingers after running.
